com.here.android.mpa.electronic_horizon

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.electronic_horizon.Position

  • public final class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    Position is created every time after electronic horizon is updated. It contains the information about current position.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getOffsetCentimeters()
      Returns the distance from the logical beginning of the main PathTree to the current position of the vehicle.
      PathTree getPathTree()
      Returns the entire path in the tree.
      double getSpeedMetersPerSecond()
      Returns the speed of the vehicle's movement at timestamp.
      java.util.Date getTimestamp()
      Returns the time when the gps signal was received after electronic horizon was updated.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getOffsetCentimeters

        public int getOffsetCentimeters()
        Returns the distance from the logical beginning of the main PathTree to the current position of the vehicle. The logical beginning is the position of the update call that resulted in a path tree reset, thus an entire new PathTree was created.
        Returns:
        The distance in centimeters.

      • getSpeedMetersPerSecond

        public double getSpeedMetersPerSecond()
        Returns the speed of the vehicle's movement at timestamp.
        Returns:
        The speed in meters per seconds.

      • getTimestamp

        public java.util.Date getTimestamp()
        Returns the time when the gps signal was received after electronic horizon was updated.
        Returns:
        The timestamp.

      • getPathTree

        public PathTree getPathTree()
        Returns the entire path in the tree.
        Returns:
        The entire path in the tree. If current position is off-road then null.
